thread.title_full: New Pokémon Stadium-Like Mobile Game Announced at Pokémon Presents

author: Frank Reyes
title: New Pokémon Stadium-Like Mobile Game Announced at Pokémon Presents
text:
A new Pokémon battle-centered game called Pokémon Champions is coming to Nintendo Switch and mobile devices. Announced during the Pokémon Presents presentation, the game will focus on player-versus-player battles. From what can be seen in the trailer, it will allow for 2v2 battles and will also feature cross-play between smartphones and consoles.
Battles will feature all the traditional elements of the battle system from the mainline Pokémon games. That means species, abilities, moves, and more will be in play. On the other hand, it was revealed that this new game will be able to connect to Pokémon Home to use creatures from other related games.

A New Battle-Focused Pokémon Spin-Off
During the Pokémon Presents presentation, Pokémon Champions was officially revealed, a new Pokémon battle-focused spin-off for Nintendo Switch and smartphones. This game will feature all the core battle mechanics of Pokémon games, such as type advantages and automatic abilities. Another special detail, as seen in the trailer, is that special moves from different generations will be available in one place, such as Mega Evolutions from Pokémon X/Y and Terastal Forms from Pokémon Scarlet/Violet.
The teaser shows a battle between a Dondozo and an Aegislash against a Charizard and a Hisuian Samurott. This confirms the possibility of bringing Pokémon from different games through the Pokémon Home connection, as the Aegislash is from Pokémon Sword/Shield, while the Hisuian Samurott is from Pokémon Legends: Arceus. Also emphasized was the possibility of cross-platform battles between consoles and mobile phones, a feature previously seen in the online MOBA Pokémon Unite.
Similar to Pokémon Stadium and Pokémon Colosseum, battles will take place in a Pokémon Battle Arena. This is the first time in nearly 20 years that a new spin-off focused on Pokémon battles has been announced, the last being Pokémon Battle Revolution for Nintendo Wii in 2006. This particular game allowed the Nintendo DS to be connected to use equipment from Pokémon Diamond, Pearl, and Platinum.

Why There Needs To Be A Modern Pokémon Stadium Now More Than Ever
Between balancing casual and more competitive gameplay and the wealth of features, Pokémon Stadium needs a modern comeback.
This announcement has been the start of many discussions, as it presents an option focused on gamers who prefer the battles of the games rather than the exploration and adventure component. Rumors are already circulating that this could signal a change in the Pokémon competitive scene, abandoning the tournaments held in the mainline games and using this new Pokémon Champions as a special main platform for official ranked matches.
A release date has not yet been announced, and it has only been stated that Pokémon Champions is in development, but it's possible that this title may have connectivity features with games that will be released for the Nintendo Switch 2. One such game could be Pokémon Legends: Z-A, which is said to be available for both the new console and the original Nintendo Switch. Several new features were also recently revealed for this game.
Source: The Pokémon Company
